abstract: For the two activist hedge funds who had long called for a sale of Topps, Tuesday’s announcement that the baseball card maker would sell itself was hardly cause for celebration. Topps director Arnaud Ajdler of Crescendo Partners — one of the two funds that eventually won representation on the Topps board — quickly came out against the proposed $385 million sale to Tornante, Michael D. Eisner’s investment firm, and Madison Dearborn Partners, a Chicago-based buyout firm.
